title: No children node listing when changing data source in the data set editor page of the query tab
OB:
When changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab, the children nodes are not listed. 

Steps to Reproduce: 
1. Create a new data set without a SQL statement. 
2. Ensure that the new data source has no database/table/column information. 

Actual Result: 
After changing the data source for the data set in the data set editor page of the query tab, the children nodes are not listed. 

Close the data set editor and reopen it.
EB: The children nodes of the new data source should be listed when changing the data source.
SR:
1. Create a new data set without a SQL statement. 
2. Ensure that the new data source has no database/table/column information. 
3. Open the data set editor in the query tab. 
4. Change the data source for the data set. 
5. Verify that the children nodes of the new data source are listed.
